user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of process_short_params_str:
```c
static enum PerfRepl_param_result
process_short_params_str (const char *params_str, const char *next_param)
{
  if (0 == params_str[0])
  {
    fprintf (stderr, "Unrecognised parameter: -\n");
    return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
  }
  do
  {
    enum PerfRepl_param_result param_res;
    param_res = process_short_param (params_str, next_param);
    if (PERF_RPL_PARAM_ONE_CHAR != param_res)
      return param_res;
  } while (0 != (++params_str)[0]);
  return PERF_RPL_PARAM_FULL_STR;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (0 == params_str[0])
{
  fprintf (stderr, "Unrecognised parameter: -\n");
  return PERF_RPL_PARAM_ERROR;
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The branch is reachable when params_str points to an empty string (params_str[0] == '\0'), e.g. the caller passes "" or a pointer to a zero-length string; in that case the fprintf and return execute. (Unreachable only if the call site can be proven to never pass an empty string, which is not shown.)
